Po brutalnem padcu je napovedal vrnitev
Nadarjeni motokrosist Maks Mausser, ki se je marca hudo poškodoval na treningu, že načrtuje vnovične treninge.
02 Nov 2019, 17:28 by Drago Perko



DRAGO PERKOPo eni od rehabilitacij smo ga obiskali v Trbovljah. FOTO: DRAGO PERKO



DRAGO PERKORehabilitacija je zelo naporna. FOTO: DRAGO PERKO



M.M.Maks Mausser brezpogojno zaupa Bogu Gajserju. FOTO: OSEBNI ARHIV



OSEBNI ARHIV M.M.Ta fant bo še zmagoval! FOTO: OSEBNI ARHIV


Šport prinaša lepe in malo manj lepe trenutke, zmage in poraze, vzpone in padce. Na koncu si zmagovalec, če je število tvojih vzponov za eno večje kot število padcev. S tem se v teh dneh uspešno bori, to smo se lahko prepričali kar sami, 16-letni Trboveljčan Maks Mausser.


Rehabilitacija je zelo naporna. FOTO: DRAGO PERKODRAGO PERKO

Obiskali smo ga v Zasavju, kjer živi s svojo družino, ki je tudi v teh mesecih njegova glavna podpora. Še bolj kot takrat, ko je kot fantič prvič zajahal motor. Ko je bil namreč star tri leta in pol, mu je oče obljubil motor, če se bo vozil na kolesu brez opornih koleščkov. 
Nesreča na treningu
Minuli dve sezoni je Maks tekmoval na dirkah evropskega prvenstva EMX125, lani pa so se dogovorili, da je čas za korak naprej. Oče je poklical Boga Gajserja, in ta je Maksa sprejel v svojo ekipo. "Bogu sem povsem zaupal. Tudi če je šlo za linijo ali skok, za katerega nisem bil povsem prepričan, da ga zmorem," pravi Maks, ki je z njim v stiku vsak dan, občasno pa se sliši tudi s Timom, ki je zanj prvak z dobrim srcem. Na sezono v razredu MX2 se je dobro pripravil. Treniral je s Timom Gajserjem, mu sledil na vsakem koraku in pridno požiral znanje in širil svoj diapazon izkušenj. Ovinek za ovinkom, skok za skokom ...
metrov zmore danes narediti s hoduljo.
Nad tem je bil navdušen tudi Maksov mentor Bogo Gajser, s katerim sta nestrpno čakala dirko v Angliji. A tja ni prišel. Maks je na treningu nesrečno padel, motor pa nanj. Prve diagnoze so bile hude, saj mu je celo grozilo, da zavoljo poškodovanih vretenc in prizadete hrbtenjače morda ne bo več hodil. Danes s hoduljo že naredi 200 metrov, drugo leto bi rad znova sedel na motor. Jasno, Maks je borec in garač. 
Nikola in Marjan
"Dober mesec in pol nisem več na Univerzitetnem rehabilitacijskem inštitutu Soča. Treniram s svojo ekipo, tako kot nekoč, le program smo prilagodili trenutni situaciji. Pomemben člen je Marjan, ki je bil prej moj kondicijski trener, tudi zdaj na neki način fizično trenirava. Opravljam tudi posebno terapijo, ki jo v Laškem izvaja fizioterapevt Nikola. Mesec in pol delava, pa so rezultati vidni," začne Maks.Priznava, da mu je bilo prvi mesec malce lažje, saj je bil napredek bolj viden. "Bistveno je bilo, da sem začutil noge. To je pomenilo, da je šel signal vsaj delno skozi hrbtenjačo in da stik ostaja. To je ključno. Priznam, da sem si po tem kar malce oddahnil. Noge premikam, potem smo nadaljevali s hojo, korak za korakom. Mikrocilji me ne zanimajo toliko, a vem, da brez njih ne gre," ostaja miren in potrpežljiv Maks.173 in 731Ko je Maks začenjal svojo športno pot, je sprva imel številko 173. Z njo je dirkal tudi na nemškem prvenstvu, kamor so Mausserjevi odšli po izkušnje in znanje, saj je bila doma preslaba konkurenca. V drugi sezoni v Nemčiji je ostal brez te številke, saj je po njej segel nekdo drug. Ostal je zvest števkam 1, 7 in 3, le vrstni red je drug – 731.V karieri ni imel velikih poškodb. Ko se zgodi kaj takega, je šok sprva zelo velik. "Na srečo imam ob sebi krasne ljudi, vključno z Bogom Gajserjem, ki mi ves čas stoji ob strani, na pomoč je poklical tudi zdravnika iz Hrvaške. Ko sem bil še v bolnišnici v Mariboru, je Bogo trdil, da bom hodil. Tudi na intenzivni negi so bili ob meni krasni zdravniki in medicinski bratje, ki so izjemno lepo skrbeli zame. Dejstvo je, da se nisem nikoli sprijaznil z invalidskim vozičkom. Garamo in delamo, da bi kar najhitreje spet lahko hodil. Prvih 200 metrov je za mano, s hoduljo hodim po šoli. Pred mano pa so še ure trdega dela, da bom hodil in spet sedel na motor," je odločen Maks. 
Hvaležen družini in šoli
Pravijo, da je motokros zahteven šport, a Maks pravi, da je rehabilitacija po težki poškodbi še dvakrat težja. Malce lažje je, ker je bil pred tem tako dobro fizično pripravljen. Zdaj pa je spoznal, da mora biti tudi v glavi vse na svojem mestu, saj moraš verjeti, da bo uspelo. Cilj je jasen: najprej mora okrepiti mišice, ki so po trimesečnem mirovanju oslabele. Na rehabilitacijo odhaja do šestkrat na teden, najmanj en dan v tednu je prost. "Telo je še v šoku, ne smem ga preveč obremeniti," preudarno pove Maks, neskončno hvaležen očetu, mami, sestri, dedku in babici, staremu očetu in stari mami ter stricu, ki mu na vsakem koraku pomagajo in stojijo ob strani.Nesreča se je zgodila marca, v šoli pa so bili izjemno razumevajoči.Dobrodelni bratje IrtEkipa Irt Brothers s prijatelji tudi letos organizira dobrodelni trening. Letos zbirajo denar za pomoč pri rehabilitaciji treh fantov, tudi Maksa Mausserja, enega največjih upov slovenskega motokrosa. Pomoč bodo namenili še Aneju Dopliharju, ki je osvajal sam vrh slovenskega motokrosa in se preizkusil v prestižnem tekmovanju MX2 za veliko nagrado Švice 2016. Žal je malo pozneje nesrečno padel na pokalni tekmi in postal paraplegik. Našel je nov šport in se septembra že udeležil prve tekme za svetovno prvenstvo v parakolesarstvu. Sebastjan Bahur je bil med najbolj perspektivnimi motokrosisti, a je po padcu v Mantovi postal tetraplegik. Za dobrodelni trening v Žireh je bilo prijavljenih več kot 50 voznikov, vsak pa je prispeval 60 evrov v sklad za pomoč fantom. Trening je potekal pod vodstvom treh bratov Irt, Matevža, Jerneja in Petra, ter očeta Andreja.Sošolci so poskrbeli za zapiske, tako da se Maks lahko uči doma. V takih trenutkih spoznaš, kdo so pravi prijatelji, pove Maks in doda, da bratje Irt zbirajo denar za tri tekmovalce, tudi zanj, ki so se poškodovali na tekmi ali treningu. Njegova družina zdaj vse plačuje iz svojega žepa, pogrešajo pa podporo AMZS, katerega barve je vedno ponosno zastopal. "Vem, da se bom vrnil na motor in spet ponosno dirkal za Slovenijo!" sklene Maks.

After the brutal fall, he announced his return
The talented motocross player Max Mausser, who suffered severe injuries in training in March, is already planning a re-workout.
02 Nov 2019, 16:28 by Drago Perko



DEAR PERKOP We visited him in Trbovlje after one of his rehabilitations. PHOTO: DEAR PERKO



DEAR PERKOR Rehabilitation is very strenuous. PHOTO: DEAR PERKO



M.M.Max Mausser trusts God Geyser unconditionally. PHOTO: PERSONAL ARCHIVE



PERSONAL ARCHIVE M.M.This boy will still win! PHOTO: PERSONAL ARCHIVE


Sport brings nice and a little less beautiful moments, victories and defeats, ups and downs. In the end, you're the winner if the number of your climbs is one higher than the number of falls. He has been successfully battling these days, we could see for ourselves, 16-year-old Trbovelj Maks Mausser.


Rehabilitation is very tiring. PHOTO: DEAR PERKODRAGO PERKO

We visited him in Zasavje, where he lives with his family, which is his main support even during these months. Even more so when he first rode the engine as a boy. When he was three-and-a-half years old, his father had promised him an engine if he would ride on a bicycle without a support wheel.
Training accident
For the past two seasons, Max has competed in the EMX125 European Championship races, and last year agreed that it was time to move on. The father called God Geyser, and he accepted Max into his team. "I trusted God completely. Even if it was a line or a jump that I wasn't quite sure I could do," says Max, who interacts with him every day and occasionally hears Tim speak to him. a champion with a good heart. He prepared well for the season in the MX2 class. He trained with Tim Gajser, followed him every step of the way, and devoured his knowledge and broadened his range of experiences. Turn by bend, jump after jump ...
meters he can do today with a walker.
Max's mentor, Bogo Gajser, was also impressed by this, and they were eagerly awaiting the race in England. But he did not get there. Max crashed miserably in training, and the engine on him. The first diagnoses were severe as he even threatened to stop walking because of damaged vertebrae and a spinal cord. Today, he already makes 200 meters with a walker, and in the second year I would like to get on the motor again. Clearly, Max is a fighter and a sucker.
Nicholas and Marjan
"For more than a month and a half, I am no longer at the Soča University Rehabilitation Institute. I train with my team, as in the past, we have just adapted the program to the current situation. An important link is Marjan, who used to be my fitness coach, even now, in some ways, physically training. I also perform special therapy, which is performed in Laško by the physiotherapist Nikola. We have been working for a month and a half, but the results are visible, "Max admits. "It was essential that I felt my legs. That meant that the signal went at least partially through the spinal cord and that contact remained. This is key. I admit that I took a little breath after that. I move my legs, then we continued walking. step by step. I don't care about micro-targets so much, but I know that without them, "he remains calm and patient. Max.173 and 731When Max started his sports career, he initially had the number 173. He also raced in German. championship, where the Mausser went for experience and knowledge, because at home there was too little competition. In the second season in Germany, he was left out of this number because someone else had reached him. He remained true to the digits 1, 7 and 3, only the order is second - 731. He did not suffer major injuries in his career. When something like this happens, the shock is very big at first. "Fortunately, I have wonderful people with me, including God Geyser, who always stands by my side, and he called a doctor from Croatia for help. When I was still in the hospital in Maribor, Bogo claimed that I would go. Intensive care was given to me by the wonderful doctors and medical brothers who took great care of me. The fact is that I never got into a wheelchair. We work and work so that I can walk again as fast as possible. The first 200 meters are behind me. I walk around the school with a walker. There are still hours of hard work ahead of me to walk and sit on the motor again, "Max is determined.
Grateful to family and school
Motocross is said to be a challenging sport, but Maks says rehabilitation is twice as difficult after a serious injury. It's a little easier because he was so physically fit before. But now he realized that everything must be in place in his head as well, because you have to believe that it will work. The goal is clear: it must first strengthen the muscles that have weakened after three months of rest. He goes to rehab up to six times a week, at least one day a week is free. "The body is still in shock, I must not overburden it," says Max prudently, gratefully grateful to his father, mother, sister, grandfather and grandmother, old father and old mother and uncle, who help and stand by his side at every turn. happened in March, and they were extremely understanding at school. Irt Brothers Irt Brothers charity train with friends also this year. This year, they are raising money to help rehabilitate three boys, including Maks Mausser, one of the biggest hopes of Slovenian motocross. They will also help Ane Doplihar, who won the very top of Slovenian motocross and tested himself in the prestigious MX2 Grand Prix of Switzerland 2016. Unfortunately, he fell down a bit later in the Cup and became a paraplegic. He has found a new sport and has already participated in the first World Championships in Parachuting in September. Sebastjan Bahur was one of the most promising motocross players, but after a fall in Mantova he became a tetraplegic. More than 50 drivers have applied for charity training in Jire, each contributing $ 60 to a fund to help the boys. The training was conducted under the guidance of three brothers Irt, Matevž, Jernej and Peter, and father Andrei. The students took care of the notes so that Max could study at home. In such moments, you get to know who your real friends are, says Max, adding that the Irt brothers raise money for three competitors, including those who have injured themselves in a race or training session. His family is now paying everything out of their own pocket, and they miss the support of AMZS, whose colors he has always proudly represented. "I know I'll be back on the bike and proudly racing for Slovenia again!" concludes Max.
